properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 52.

properties.note: Derived from 6 yin lines × 24 per line (Chthonic Reckoning).
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 52.
properties.label: Number

properties.note: Fourth power of yang number 3 (3⁴ = 81); used as Day Factor (日法之數) in lunation calculations, representing the harmonic unit for subdividing lunar cycles.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 40.
properties.label: Number

properties.symbolic_meaning_en: Day Factor. The fourth power of the yang number 3 (3⁴ = 81), representing the harmonic origin of the calendrical system. This number embodies the cosmological and harmonic basis for the construction of calendrical units.
properties.cullen_quote_en: This number is the divisor of the fractional part of days in a (mean) lunation. As the text states, it is supposed to be derived from considerations of mathematical harmonics, for which the fundamental note is the one named ‘Yellow Bell’... The fourth power of the yang number 3 is 81, and when multiplied by 10... it represents the volume of the pitch pipe producing that note.
properties.original_text_zh: 太始元元，黃鐘之首九自乘為律首之數，以得日法之分。
properties.original_text_en: At the Origin Initiation, the First 9 of the Yellow Bell multiplies itself, which is the number of the first pitchpipe; one obtains the Day Factor.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 40
properties.name_en: First Nine of the Yellow Bell

properties.note: Concordance Factor (會法), the product of Day Factor (81) and Intercalation Factor (19). It represents the core numerical cycle in which solar and lunar rhythms are coordinated in calendrical computation.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 41.
properties.label: Number

properties.symbolic_meaning_en: Symbolic structure used to derive the Lunation Factor. Encodes operations on the number 49 and related values—including multiplication by 2, 3, and 4, followed by additions of 19 and 1, and final doubling—producing 2392 units of 1/81 days per lunation.
properties.cullen_quote_en: The Lunation Factor 2392 is calculated through an extended symbolic chain: (49 × 2 × 3 × 4 + 19 + 1) × 2 = 2392. These numbers stem from the divinatory arithmetic of the Book of Change and cosmological construction in early Chinese thought… Extending the image of the Great Expansion, one obtains the Lunation Factor.
properties.original_text_zh: 大衍之數五十，其用四十有九……倍之以二象二，三之以三象三，四之以四象四，加十九象閏，又加一象用一，復倍之象再揲之法，以成步法。
properties.name: 大衍之象
properties.original_text_en: The number of the Great Expansion is 50; of these, 49 are used… this is doubled to represent 2, trebled for 3, quadrupled for 4, then 19 (symbolizing intercalation) is added, and 1 (symbolizing the ‘occupied one’) is added, then the whole is doubled for the two-handled manipulation. This yields the Lunation Factor.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 43

properties.note: Lunation Factor (步法), represents the number of 1/81-day units per lunation, constructed through symbolic-numerical operations in the system of the Great Expansion.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 43
properties.label: Number

properties.note: Used as the terminal number of Heaven (天之終數) in symbolic calendrical construction; forms part of the Intercalation Factor when summed with 10.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41
properties.label: Number

properties.meaning_en: yang, Heaven, nine, terminal yang number
properties.meaning_zh_simple: 阳, 天, 九, 阳数终点
properties.cullen_quote_en: 9 and 10 are simply the last pair of numbers in the list, and when added they make 19. This is the number of civil years (1 Rule) containing seven intercalary months.
properties.original_text_en: Heaven is nine, Earth is ten; summing their terminal numbers yields nineteen.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41
properties.related_concepts_simple: 阳, 天, 九, 阳数终点
properties.related_concepts: 陽, 天, 九, 陽數終點
properties.original_text_zh: 天九地十，终数相加得十九。
properties.name: 天之終數
properties.meaning_zh: 陽, 天, 九, 陽數終點

properties.note: Used as the terminal number of Earth (地之終數) in symbolic calendrical construction; forms part of the Intercalation Factor when summed with 9.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41
properties.label: Number

properties.meaning_en: yin, Earth, ten, terminal yin number
properties.meaning_zh_simple: 阴, 地, 十, 阴数终点
properties.cullen_quote_en: 9 and 10 are simply the last pair of numbers in the list, and when added they make 19. This is the number of civil years (1 Rule) containing seven intercalary months.
properties.original_text_en: Heaven is nine, Earth is ten; summing their terminal numbers yields nineteen.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41
properties.related_concepts_simple: 阴, 地, 十, 阴数终点
properties.related_concepts: 陰, 地, 十, 陰數終點
properties.original_text_zh: 天九地十，终数相加得十九。
properties.name: 地之終數
properties.meaning_zh: 陰, 地, 十, 陰數終點

properties.meaning_en: yang, yin, terminal numbers, union, intercalation
properties.meaning_zh_simple: 阳, 阴, 终数, 合一, 闰法
properties.cullen_quote_en: 9 and 10 are simply the last pair of numbers in the list, and when added they make 19. This is the number of civil years (1 Rule) containing seven intercalary months, making a total of 235 months. The pattern of intercalations repeats at this interval.
properties.original_text_en: Joining the ultimate numbers of Heaven and Earth, one obtains the Intercalation Factor.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41
properties.related_concepts_simple: 天九, 地十, 阳阴, 终数, 闰法
properties.system: 陰陽 + 易象 + 歷法 system (yin–yang cosmology and calendrical intercalation)
properties.related_concepts: 天九, 地十, 陽陰, 終數, 閏法
properties.original_text_zh: 合天地之終數得閏法之數也。
properties.name: 天地終數合
properties.name_en: Sum of Heaven and Earth Terminal Numbers
properties.meaning_zh: 陽, 陰, 終數, 合一, 閏法

properties.note: Intercalation Factor (閏法之數), derived by summing the terminal numbers of Heaven (9) and Earth (10). It governs the cycle of seven intercalary months over every 19 solar years, reflecting the yin–yang reconciliation in calendrical cosmology.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41
properties.label: Number

properties.symbolic_meaning_en: A calendrical system that coordinates three reckonings of time—celestial, terrestrial, and anthropic—based on the harmonizing cycle defined by the Concordance Factor (1539).
properties.meaning_en: triple time alignment: celestial, terrestrial, anthropic
properties.cullen_quote_en: The number 1539 is the foundational cycle for the three Concordances: celestial, terrestrial, and anthropic.
properties.original_text_en: The Day Factor is 81, the Intercalation Factor is 19; their product gives the Concordance Factor.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 41
properties.system: 漢代曆法制度 (Han calendrical systems)
properties.original_text_zh: 日法八十一，閏法十九，相乘以得會法。
properties.name: 三統
properties.meaning_zh: 天統、地統、人統三種曆法節律的統一協調

properties.symbolic_meaning_en: The celestial aspect of the Triple Concordance system, corresponding to solar time cycles.
properties.cullen_quote_en: The Celestial Concordance aligns with the Xia calendar's 11th month, beginning at the winter solstice.
properties.original_text_en: Celestial Concordance: the year begins with the month of the winter solstice.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 41
properties.original_text_zh: 天統者，以冬至之月為歲首。
properties.name: 天統
properties.meaning_zh: 太陽時間的統攝與調和

properties.symbolic_meaning_en: The terrestrial aspect of the Triple Concordance system, corresponding to lunar and intercalary time.
properties.cullen_quote_en: The Terrestrial Concordance begins in the 12th Xia month, aligning with midwinter but later than the winter solstice.
properties.original_text_en: Terrestrial Concordance: the year begins with the twelfth month.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 41
properties.name: 地統
properties.meaning_zh: 陰陽曆法與閏月機制的調和

properties.symbolic_meaning_en: The anthropic aspect of the Triple Concordance system, corresponding to ritual time and human scheduling.
properties.cullen_quote_en: The Anthropic Concordance follows ritual precedence, aligning the year start with the 1st month for human affairs and ceremonial rhythm.
properties.original_text_en: Anthropic Concordance: the year begins with the first month of spring.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 41
properties.name: 人統
properties.meaning_zh: 人事禮儀與曆法週期的配合

properties.note: Symbolically represents the ‘occupied one’ (用一), signifying the Dao. Added in the construction of the Lunation Factor before final doubling.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 43
properties.label: Number

properties.cullen_quote_en: The ‘occupied one’ (用一) is added before doubling. This represents the Dao in the symbolic structure of the Lunation Factor.
properties.original_text_en: One is added but not used in calculation, representing the Dao.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 43
properties.related_concepts_simple: 用一, 占位, 元始, 本体, 起始之数
properties.related_concepts: 用一, 占位, 元始, 本體, 起始之數
properties.original_text_zh: 五十以象之，其用四十九，而弃一以象道。
properties.name: 道
properties.meaning_zh: 元始, 一體, 虛無, 生發之源

properties.original_text_tr: śaśin somaś cenduś ca prāleyāṃśurajanīkaraḥ himagur mṛgāṅkaś ca kalādharaś caiva candramāḥ
properties.original_text_en: śaśin, soma, indu, prāleyāṃśu, rajanīkaraḥ, himagu, mṛgāṅka, and kalādharaḥ are all names of the moon.
properties.original_text_zh: 有兔者、蘇摩、水滴、冰霜之光、夜之造者、雪中行者、有鹿斑者、陰影之持者等皆為月亮之名。
properties.original_text_sa: शशिन् सोमश्चेन्दुश्च प्रालेयांशुरजनीकरः । हिमगुर्मृगाङ्कश्च कलाधरश्चैव चन्द्रमाः ॥
properties.name: चन्द्र candra / 月亮 moon
properties.petrocchi_quote_en: All these are synonyms or poetic epithets of the moon, and by extension are used to represent the number one in Bhūta-saṃkhyā notations.

properties.note: Represents Earth (地) in yin–yang numerology; forms part of the Earthly (yin) sequence in the Book of Changes.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 41
properties.label: Number

properties.cullen_quote_en: The number 2 is part of the Earthly (yin) sequence in the Book of Changes.
properties.original_text_en: The even numbers—2, 4, 6, 8, 10—are assigned to Earth (yin).
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 41
properties.related_concepts_simple: 二, 地之数, 偶数, 阴象
properties.related_concepts: 二, 地之數, 偶數, 陰象
properties.name: 地
properties.meaning_zh: 陰性, 承載, 雙數, 靜定

properties.note: Represents Heaven (天) in yin–yang numerology; forms part of the Heavenly (yang) sequence in the Book of Changes and the base of calendrical harmonic numbers.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41
properties.label: Number

properties.cullen_quote_en: The number 3 belongs to the Heavenly (yang) sequence and forms the base of calendrical harmonic constructions.
properties.original_text_en: The odd numbers—1, 3, 5, 7, 9—are assigned to Heaven (yang).
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 40
properties.related_concepts_simple: 三, 天之数, 奇数, 阳象
properties.related_concepts: 三, 天之數, 奇數, 陽象
properties.name: 天
properties.meaning_zh: 陽性, 生發, 三才, 奇數

properties.note: Symbolic number associated with completeness and structural generation; used in calendrical operations such as 49×2×3×4 in the construction of the Lunation Factor.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 43
properties.label: Number

properties.cullen_quote_en: The number 4 symbolizes structuring multiplicity in the divinatory calculation of the Lunation Factor.
properties.original_text_en: Multiplied by 4 to form the structure of the Lunation Factor.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 43
properties.related_concepts_simple: 四, 成形, 四象, 宇宙结构
properties.related_concepts: 四, 成形, 四象, 宇宙結構
properties.original_text_zh: 四之以四象四，以成步法。
properties.name: 成法
properties.meaning_zh: 結構, 完滿, 生化, 穩定

properties.note: The number of usable yarrow stalks in divination, foundational to the symbolic arithmetic used in calendrical construction.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 43
properties.label: Number
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 43

properties.label: Number
properties.note: Used as the final odd (yang) number in calendrical computation; denotes the utmost of yang.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41

properties.label: Number
properties.note: Used as the final even (yin) number in calendrical computation; basis of Pure Yin structure and hexagram division.
properties.source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41

properties.meaning_en: usable yarrow stalks, symbolic count, calendrical base
properties.meaning_zh_simple: 可用蓍草, 象征数, 历法根基
properties.cullen_quote_en: The number of the Great Expansion is 50; of these, 49 are used…
properties.original_text_en: The number of the Great Expansion is 50; of these, 49 are used…
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, p. 43
properties.related_concepts_simple: 大衍, 蓍草, 象数, 筮法, 天地生成
properties.related_concepts: 大衍, 蓍草, 象數, 筮法, 天地生成
properties.original_text_zh: 大衍之數五十，其用四十九……
properties.name: 大衍之數
properties.meaning_zh: 可用蓍草, 象徵數, 曆法根基

properties.name: 陰極之數
properties.meaning_en: final yin number, foundational unit in yarrow-stalk and hexagram structures
properties.meaning_zh: 偶數終點，蓍草與卦體之基
properties.meaning_zh_simple: 偶数终点，蓍草与卦体之基
properties.cullen_quote_en: In calendrical and divinatory symbolism, the number six marks the limit of the yin series and serves as the basis of the Pure Yin hexagram（六陰卦）.
properties.original_text_en: The utmost number of Yin is six.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41
properties.related_concepts: 陰, 偶數, 地, 卦體
properties.related_concepts_simple: 阴, 偶数, 地, 卦体
properties.label: Symbol

properties.name: 陽極之數
properties.meaning_en: final yang number, culmination of celestial activity
properties.meaning_zh: 奇數極點，天道推演之終
properties.meaning_zh_simple: 奇数极点，天道推演之终
properties.cullen_quote_en: In the system presented, yang numbers are odd and increase to five. This is the final number used before the yin sequence begins.
properties.original_text_en: The utmost number of Yang is five.
properties.cullen_source: Christopher Cullen, The Foundations of Celestial Reckoning, pp. 40–41
properties.related_concepts: 陽, 奇數, 天, 極數
properties.related_concepts_simple: 阳, 奇数, 天, 极数
properties.label: Symbol
